title: Kirin 950 is still a great performer compared to the budget chips
Bad product - not recommended

Five Stars
Good phone, spoiled by bad software features.
The beast under Rs.25000
one of the best camera in this price range I have ever used
A little brief review
review:
Although honor 8 is a bit old now its checks all the boxes. You won't be
getting a 18:9 display and latest android but the device is fast and
responsive. Kirin 950 is still a great performer compared to the budget chips.
I really like the glass back of this phone and fingerprint reader is fast and
responsive. Camera is great, it has a usb type-c port, the screen is also
gorgeous for a 1080p display with nice viewing angles and sunlight
readability.  
It might not make sense to buy a phone with big bezels and older android
versions right now but if you look past them honor 8 is a superb phone.

Wifi not working. Network signal not getting connected. Heats up like an iron
box. Poor battery performance. Good camera and design.

great smartphone with monstrous spec. just it has single sim only , charged
fast but drains too quickly, heats up .. after discharging below 20 % it
starts lagging , though there is 100% charging we can use 98 % of it , when it
reaches to 2 % it switch off automatically . though it has shiny look but it
is too much delicate to handle , scratches can be viewed on side edges clearly
and it is irritating, it is extremely slippery as it has glass coating on back
, better to use back cover , it catches fingerprint so better to buy pearl
white color if you are going to buy honor 8 . we don't get earphones with the
package .. color reproduction is amazing on this phone , camera is good ,
internal memory available is only 26-28 GB . one has to handle this smartphone
with care more than his Girlfriend n he deserves that too !

excellent phne decent camera loved it ... bought in deal price ... thanks to
amazon

The phone is very good hardware wise, although it's completely covered with
glass, so it's incredibly slippery even for usually safe hands. You'll
definitely want a case - if you want to retain the look, gp for a transparent
case.  
  
The software (Android with EMUI) is where things fall apart - EMUI is badly
designed. It can't decide whether it wants to keep an andeoid feel or rip off
iOS look, and ends up doing neither. Probably it combines the worst of both
worlds. After spending some time uninstalling bloated apps and disabling a lot
of huwaei "features", the phone became a little useable. Also, I'm not sure
their "battery optimizations" are not just a way to keep users from using
better third party apps.

This flagship from honor is a beast! It is superfast in processing and ram
management. I am writing its review after 6 months of purchase. It has a good
set of cameras for photography. It has an ergonomic design. The fingerprint
sensor is the best among any device! Even after 6 months use, this device has
not slowed down!  
PROS:  
1\. The cameras both front and rear.(photography)  
2\. The speed. It is beast in terms of processing.  
At a price range of under 25000 phones, you can surely go for this phone in
terms of processing speeds and cameras. The cameras capture better and real ti
life colours. It is better than iphone 6s in terms of colour capture.  
3\. The build quality is excellent. It is surely the most beautiful phone
under Rs.30000 category.  
4\. The EMUI. It is a very powerful UI. Gives access to a lot of
functionality.  
5\. The fingerprint sensor. Honor might have the most customisable fingerprint
sensor. It very fast and a lot of features are embedded in it.  
6\. Its Full HD display is crisp.  
7\. The IR blaster. You can control a huge amount of devices.  
  
CONS:  
1\. There is no gorilla glass.  
2\. The videography is not good.  
3\. No earphones provided by honor.  
4\. No larger storage variant available.  
5\. The display's brightness is less than other phones. This creates a problem
when using phone in sunlight.  
6\. Has an hybrid sim slot.  
  
Its pros obviously overcome its cons. You can blindly purchase this device.

one of the best camera in this price range I have ever used...  
go for it without any hesitation  
no lags  
4gb ram is enough  
design 10/10  
little bit slippery but it's ok.  
one year more warranty included... what else....

The phone is worth buying it, I would like to share each and every experience
with the phone.  
DESIGN: The phone uses one of the best designs in the market, the 15 layer
glass back adds more credits to its design.  
CAMERA: The camera is just awesome, at this price range, it can compete even
with the iPhone 7 plus, in most areas the Honor 8 leads the battle, but in low
light and no light conditions more noise is found, better to use manual
controls at night, lack of OIS is an drawback.  
BATTERY: Takes nearly 1.30 - 2.00 hrs to get fully charged, battery lasts upto
a day and a half on normal usage, for hard users it will last upto 8-10 hrs.  
SOFTWARE: The EMUI software isn't a best software in the market, even though
they have certain features which are not in others, the interface a little bit
clumsy and ugly.

title: Spectacular product. Reckless seller.
great mobile under this range
Best buy for 15k no compition in camera segment under 15k

**4 months later**
HONOR - For the brave
ALL IN ONE REVIEW FOR HONOR 8
EXCELLENT PHONE
Under-rated.
Beast for the price which u pay..😎
review:
Display - Good quality and sunlight legibility is average.  
  
Processor - Fast, efficient and battery saving.  
  
Ram - Didn't expect this. But nougat rom consumes about 2gb memory without any
apps running.  
  
Battery - Given all the hardware-software optimisation. A stellar performance
at 3000mah.  
  
Camera - Bashes all other phones in this price range and many others far more
costlier than this.  
  
Network - Absolutely brilliant performance. No WiFi or call issues faced.
Huawei given their background with networking, has achieved something really
praiseworthy.  
  
Audio - Speaker and earpiece are satisfactory performers. But being an
audiophile, it fails miserably to my standards.  
  
Software - The best part of the phone. Tons of nitty-gritty features that make
this phone truly smart. I am stunned so see such an optimised software to
hardware relationship. Doesn't feel like stock, much smoother and zippy.
Absolutely custom tailored.  
  
THE ONLY NEGATIVE.  
  
Packaging - I do not know what's wrong with this seller. They sent my phone
without any bubble wrap or protection of any sort. They simply put my phone in
an carton and shipped it to me. Outrageous. Exasperating.

Go for it without any hesitation,no doubt u will be very happy😄.it's butter
like processor makes everything possible no matter how many tasks u want to do

Fast charging. Looks very awesome.

No BS  
Pros  
Amazing camrea- Manual mode is the highlight you can change exposure for upto
30secs. ISO as low as 50. Since it uses both sensor while taking photos you
get good contrast and details. (Good for astro photography even though you
have f2.2)  
Good processor- Kirin 950 has never let me down. I never had any lagg or frame
drops while playing games. Yet.  
Looks- The Sapphire blue varient (only) has that amazing trippy flash finish
which turns a lot of heads. The gold varient has a more brushed glass
finished.  
  
Cons  
Battery life - Well it's hard for me(heavy user) to get through a day with
single charge. My brother has the same phone but doesn't use much and has no
problem.(it loses 1-2% if kept overnight).  
OS- EMUI is nothing to brag about. They are trying to copy IOS but I would
recommend you to change the launcher as soon as you get this phone.  
Heating- It gets warm sometimes too warm for my linking. Never lags like I
mentioned before but if you are paying money to buy something so beautiful you
wouldn't want it to do this.  
Double glass=brittle- I never dropped it but I already have few minor
scratches. If you ever drop it I am sure it will crack the beautiful rear
glass.  
  
Something's which people keep asking.  
Volte= √  
Fast charging= √ (54% in 30mins)  
Camrea Stabilization= √  
Kirin 950> Snapdragon 821  
Headphone jack=√  
Verdict I would be happier if I got any other device in this price bracket.
Still better than any phone under 20k by a long margin.

Used for about a month and bought for 14999 under honor sale. Read the
complete review for better understanding of this smartphone.  
  
##Display##📱  
The display is quite gud, A 5.2inch LED screen with 443ppi pixel density gives
u fab colors.  
Rich color phenomenon and also neutral temperature screen.  
  
##Battery##🔋  
Little disappointing since it gives only about 6-7Hrs Screen On Time with
medium usage.  
And for heavy usage it gives about 4-5Hrs SOT.  
In simple terms, you'll be getting about a half day of heavy usage with this.  
  
##Processor##💻  
This smartphone uses a huawei made SoC, kirin.  
Now from prospective of a gamer, the octa core processor with 16nm
architecture and a 4GB RAM it's a beast that needs to be unleashed.  
You'll feel no lag either with multitasking or playing games.  
  
##Camera## 📷  
What can u say about a rear Dual camera of (12+12mp). Well that's correct it
proved that it's still the best under "Top smartphones with good camera under
20k". U get good options like monocolor, moving picture, time lapse, document
and a lot more.  
It features a dual temperature LED flash.  
The front camera is decent of 8MP still gives a tough fight to Mi A1.  
U can also use your voice to capture pics ;)  
  
##Design##📱  
This is a superlight smartphone if u compare it with the others in this price
segment including MI A1.  
Giving a super sleek 7.6mm thickness and an aluminum coating on the edges. It
feels gud to hold the phone.  
The back glass can get fingerprint smudged easily but u can swipe it believe
me and it still looks new.  
It's a little slippery so try a case(Go for Flipkart Smartbuy cases rough and
tough and cheap as well)  
  
##Updates##📲  
If u buy this smartphone you'll get Nougat Update Android 7.0 with EMUI 5.1
INSTANTLY  
Also in the forums it's mentioned that Honor 8 will get Oreo Update after
rolling updates for Honor flagships smartphones.  
  
##Music and Audio quality##🎧🎶  
Coming from a Sony smartphone I dont get something extra ordinary from this.
But still you'll get used to it soon.  
The ringtone comes loud enough so that u can hear it from sitting in another
room as well.  
  
##Security##📵  
What u need when u have a fingerprint scanner right? Well this uses a 0.4s
unlocking ability,  
thats just in a blink of an eye.  
It has new and a cool applock feature installed in it. You can also use A SAFE
for hiding files.  
  
##Warranty##🔄  
2years of manufacturer warranty along with 90days of screen replacement
warranty with VIP service.  
  
##Charging##🔌🔋  
The charger given in the box is a 5V/2A USB type C fast charger. This will
take 2hrs to charge honor 8 from 0% to 100%  
U can also use qualcomm charger for smart and fast charging.  
  
##MAIN CONS U WILL NOTICE IN A WEEK##📈  
1.The honor 8 heats up near the camera portion when u use the camera for 2-3
mins.  
2.Also when u play heavy games it'll heat up a little bit.  
3.Battery discharging rate is not appreciated. 50% battery gone in 2-3hrs
only.  
4\. Less bass and more of trebble when using earphones (Even in senheisser
cx180)  
5\. Nowadays when most people are having a sim for calling and one jio sim
card for data.  
It provides a single sim functionality which is disappointing.  
6\. Internal memory is only 32GB whereas other smartphones are giving 64GB in
this price segment.  
  
###OVERALL VERDICT###  
Ofcourse A coin has two sides. So if there is something gud with honor 8,
there are some glitches as well.  
But its a really gud option comparing to Redmi.  
Believe me you won't be disappointed much using this. It's a beast you just
have to learn to control it. 😉 👍

Have never used an android phone apart from the major brands - samsung, lg ,
motorolla etc, so was a little hesitant before i purchasing. Been using it for
a couple of weeks now and I must say the phone is decent.  
  
Looks different, has internals which gave the S7 a run for it's money.  
The camera could have been better, there's no dual SIM and some may not like
the screen - LCD / 1080p / 5.2".  
  
But when you factor in the price - the equation changes. Seriously feel this
phone is under-rated and worth a look if you want a good phone without the
hefty price tag.
